pulls.title: First reading, without studying the reference yet
pulls.author: stef
pulls.body:
- Mundane feedback, when asked I can ignore things too
- This is basically textual + SASL feedback
- Still need to study the Normative reference
- Curious about the actual crypto

comments.author: stef
comments.body: @vanrein please see my review. note all comments that i have not responded to are accepted and will be handled in my update.

comments.author: stef
comments.body: btw the actual crypto is of course described in the opaque spec that i marked as informal (but only because it is also just a draft and not normative, dunno if it even will be normative) but i think it is easier to explain the crypto in a call, happy to explain it to you, it's much simpler than it seems from the spec. basically it's the beautiful marriage of an OPRF and an AKE(in our case 3dh).

comments.author: stef
comments.body: pushed a version with all trivially fixed comments adopted.

comments.author: vanrein
comments.body:
"pushed a version" is indeed what I got, but I still don't know *where it is*.  I do see a merge conflict in this thread though.

I'm happy to look at another concrete version, but maybe you can post it to your repo?  It's yours after all :) and that's where I've been polling last week.

comments.author: stef
comments.body:
> "pushed a version" is indeed what I got, but I still don't know _where it is_.

the raw spec is here: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stef/sasl-opaque/main/draft-marsiske-sasl-opaque.md
or here in a more rendered form: https://github.com/stef/sasl-opaque/blob/main/draft-marsiske-sasl-opaque.md
or here in a very fancy version https://stef.github.io/sasl-opaque/draft-marsiske-sasl-opaque.html

> I do see a merge conflict in this thread though.

yes, because i took your review which was inlined with the draft, and it contains a bunch of lines with your questions and comments interleaved into the draft. this will never be merged, there will be always confilcts. i just made it into a PR so i can answer your comments here as a review.
 
> I'm happy to look at another concrete version, but maybe you can post it to your repo? 

it's all there, it's just that the changes are all trivial like fixing typos or changing the track from ietf to independent. all the other comments are still open and are awaiting your responses above here...

> It's yours after all :) and that's where I've been polling last week.
